TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit OperationDescription extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents the description of a contract operation that provides a description of the messages that make up the operation.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/includes/indigo1-md.md)] contract is a collection of operations that specifies what the endpoint communicates to the outside world. Each operation is a message exchange. For example, a request message and an associated reply message forming a request/reply message exchange.
A <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription> object is used to describe contracts and their operations. Within a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription>, each contract operation has a corresponding <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationDescription> that describes aspects of the operation, such as whether the operation is one-way or request/reply. Each <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationDescription> also describes the messages that make up the operation using a collection of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MessageDescription> objects. <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription> contains a reference to an interface that defines the contract using the programming model. This interface is marked with <xref:System.ServiceModel.ServiceContractAttribute>, and its methods that correspond to endpoint operations are marked with <xref:System.ServiceModel.OperationContractAttribute>.
Many of the properties on <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationDescription> have corresponding properties in the [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] programming model on <xref:System.ServiceModel.OperationContractAttribute>, for example, <xref:System.ServiceModel.OperationContractAttribute.IsTerminating%2A>.
## Examples The following example uses the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationDescription> returned from the collection returned by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription.Operations%2A> property of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription> class. The code iterates through the collection of endpoints and prints each endpoint name, as well as the name of each operation in the endpoint.
[!code-csharp[DataContractSerializerOperationBehavior#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/datacontractserializeroperationbehavior/cs/source.cs#2)] [!code-vb[DataContractSerializerOperationBehavior#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/datacontractserializeroperationbehavior/vb/source.vb#2)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string name, class System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription declaringContract) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the operation description.
The used to initialize the operation description.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified name and contract description.
Gets or sets the begin method of the operation.
Docs.value: The that provides access to the attributes and metadata of the method.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the operation behaviors associated with the operation.
Docs.value: A that contains the objects associated with the operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IOperationBehavior> interface is implemented to modify, examine, or extend some aspect of operation-wide execution at the application level for either client or service applications.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the contract to which the operation belongs.
Gets or sets the end method of the operation.
Docs.value: The that provides access to the attributes and metadata of the method.

Docs.summary: Gets the descriptions of the faults associated with the operation description.
Docs.value: The that contains details about the faults associated with the operation description.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the operation has had a protection level set.
Docs.value: if the protection level has been set; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks When the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationDescription.ProtectionLevel%2A> is set, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationDescription.HasProtectionLevel%2A> property is set to `true`.
<xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationDescription.HasProtectionLevel%2A> corresponds to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.OperationContractAttribute.HasProtectionLevel%2A> property in the [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/includes/indigo1-md.md)] programming model.
Use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationDescription.HasProtectionLevel%2A> property to indicate that a specific protection level is required by the messages of this operation.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the method implements an operation that can initiate a session on the server (if such a session exists).
Docs.value: if the operation is permitted to initiate a session on the server, otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.ServiceModel.OperationContractAttribute.IsInitiating%2A> property controls whether an operation can be the first operation called when a session is created.
> [!NOTE] > The value of <xref:System.ServiceModel.ServiceContractAttribute.SessionMode%2A?displayProperty=fullName> must be `true` and the binding used must support sessions for the <xref:System.ServiceModel.OperationContractAttribute.IsInitiating%2A> property to work properly.
The default is `true`, which means that an operation can be the first one called on a channel. Subsequent calls to the initiating method have no effect, other than to call the method. No other sessions are created.
Typically, you set <xref:System.ServiceModel.OperationContractAttribute.IsInitiating%2A> to `false` to force clients to call another method on the service before they can invoke this one.
<xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationDescription.IsInitiating%2A> corresponds to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.OperationContractAttribute.IsInitiating%2A> property in the [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/includes/indigo1-md.md)] programming model.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether an operation returns a reply message.
Docs.value: if this method receives a request message and returns no reply message; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationDescription.IsOneWay%2A> property to indicate that an operation does not return a reply message. This type of operation is useful for notifications or event-style communication, especially in two-way communication.
If the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationDescription.IsOneWay%2A> property is set to `false` (the default), even methods that return `void` result in a reply message. In this case, the infrastructure creates and sends an empty message to indicate to the caller that the method has returned.
<xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationDescription.IsTerminating%2A> corresponds to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.OperationContractAttribute.IsOneWay%2A> property in the [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/includes/indigo1-md.md)] programming model.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the service operation causes the server to close the session after the reply message, if any, is sent.
Docs.value: if the operation causes the server to close the session, otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationDescription.IsTerminating%2A> property to indicate that calling a service operation terminates the communication session.
<xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationDescription.IsTerminating%2A> corresponds to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.OperationContractAttribute.IsTerminating%2A> property in the [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/includes/indigo1-md.md)] programming model.

Docs.summary: Gets the known types associated with the operation description.
Docs.value: The collection of known types associated with the operation description.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The *known types* are types which may be present in an object graph when serialization or deserialization occurs. For more information about known types, see [Data Contract Known Types](~/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/data-contract-known-types.md).

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the descriptions of the messages that make up the operation.
Docs.value: A that contains descriptions of the messages that makes up the operation.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the operation description.
Docs.value: The name of the operation description.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationDescription.Name%2A> property overrides the <`operation`> element name in WSDL. The default operation name is the name of the implementing method.

Docs.summary: Gets the set of behaviors for the operation.
Docs.value: The set of behaviors for the operation.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the protection level for the operation.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationDescription.ProtectionLevel%2A> property controls whether the messages of an operation must be encrypted, signed, or both. The value set here is the default value for all messages specified for this operation unless a narrower scope overrides this value.
<xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationDescription.ProtectionLevel%2A> corresponds to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.OperationContractAttribute.ProtectionLevel%2A> property in the [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/includes/indigo1-md.md)] programming model.
When the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationDescription.ProtectionLevel%2A> is set, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationDescription.HasProtectionLevel%2A> property is set to `true`.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool ShouldSerializeProtectionLevel() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether the property has changed from its default value and should be serialized.
Docs.returns: if the property value should be serialized; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the service synchronization method of the operation description.
Docs.value: The that provides access the attributes and metadata of the method.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the method used for the task operation.
Docs.value: The method used for the task operation.
